Original question: Write a program to compute the associated (long run) total, average, and marginal cost curves given the production function f(L,K) = 2*L^(1/4)*K^(1/4).
Solution:
Long Run Average Cost = TC(r, w, Q) = Q^2 w^(1/2) r^(1/2)/2
Average Cost = AC(r, w, Q) = Q w^(1/2) r^(1/2)/2
Marginal Cost = MC(r, w, Q) = Q w^(1/2) r^(1/2)
